The okapi is a giraffid artiodactyl mammal native to the northeast of the 
Democratic Republic of the Congo in Central Africa. Although the okapi bears 
striped markings reminiscent of zebras, it is most closely related to the giraffe. 
The okapi and the giraffe are the only living members of the family Giraffidae. ...

The giraffe (Giraffa) is a genus of African even-toed ungulate mammals, the 
tallest living terrestrial animals and the largest ruminants. The genus consists of 
eleven species including Giraffa camelopardalis, the type species. Seven of 
these species are extinct, prehistoric species known from fossils, ... Their closest 
known relatives are the extinct deer-like climacocerids.
